metadata.Title: CVE-2017-15566 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - high.
metadata.Description:
Insecure SPANK environment variable handling exists in SchedMD Slurm before 16.05.11, 17.x before 17.02.9, and 17.11.x before 17.11.0rc2, allowing privilege escalation to root during Prolog or Epilog execution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15566` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpam-slurm - 17.11.2-1build1
libpmi0 - 17.11.2-1build1
libpmi2-0 - 17.11.2-1build1
libslurm-perl - 17.11.2-1build1
libslurm32 - 17.11.2-1build1
libslurmdb-perl - 17.11.2-1build1
libslurmdb32 - 17.11.2-1build1
slurm-client - 17.11.2-1build1
slurm-client-emulator - 17.11.2-1build1
slurm-wlm - 17.11.2-1build1
slurm-wlm-basic-plugins - 17.11.2-1build1
slurm-wlm-emulator - 17.11.2-1build1
slurm-wlm-torque - 17.11.2-1build1
slurmctld - 17.11.2-1build1
slurmd - 17.11.2-1build1
slurmdbd - 17.11.2-1build1
sview - 17.11.2-1build1
No subscription required

notes.Note: msalvatore> "This issue affects all Slurm versions from 15.08.0"

criterions.comment: slurm-llnl package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '17.11.2-1build1').
